I went on to purchase some preserved lemons, zaatar spice and another bag of sumac from this company.  This is a good sized bag of product.

I added two Schipperke puppies to my home eight years ago. Shortly after they arrived, they became sick with a parasite known as coccidia. From that moment on, I lived a wretched existence comprised of constant cleaning (both the dogs and anything they came near), dog antibiotics, vet bills, emergency room visits, more vet bills, on and on. By the time they were two years of age, they were down to eating only rice mixed with turkey baby food (per vet instructions) and my bank account was depleted by thousands of dollars. Yet still they suffered from diarrhea and occasional bouts of vomiting. One day I found this food on the internet, and thought, "what the hell - I've tried everything else." When the food arrived, I mixed the "dust" (reminded me of fish chum we used as kids) with cooked turkey, water, and olive oil. I fed it to the dogs. They loved it, but I expected after a year of rice and Gerber's, they'd have loved anything. By day three, their diarrhea had stopped, and the only time it has returned in the past six years is when I have run out of this food and fed them something different. Truly. Day THREE! After a two-year ordeal! This food saved my dogs' lives. I notice that the formula has changed a bit over the years, and now the package directions suggest adding an egg and fish oil - and not to use olive oil. I just keep making it the way I always have. They still love it.

There are downsides to using this food: it's soft, so plaque and tartar build up much faster than if the dogs were eating crunchy food. Also, I have to make a "batch" of food for them. I usually buy 2-1/2 lbs. of ground turkey, cook it up, grind it in the food processor, add it to 2 cups of dust, 2-1/2 cups of water, 1/4 cup olive oil, then mix it all together. Then, using a small ice cream scoop (1/4 cup), I put the food into those small disposable plastic containers made by Glad. This usually gives me 56 containers (two weeks' worth of breakfast and dinner for both dogs). I freeze the containers, putting them into the refrigerator the night before as necessary. In the morning, I dump the containers in their bowls, and microwave for 20 seconds. I guess this is a long way of saying it's more labor intensive than throwing a handful of kibble into a bowl. But, it has definitely been worth it for me and my dogs.

I would enthusiastically recommend this food to any pet owner.

I've tried two flavors - Pepperoni and Original Wild - and have enjoyed them both.  The texture's pretty good - nice and chewy.  The moisture level is okay, but it could be improved by being just a tiny bit more moist. There's also a little bit of an aftertaste (which I didn't find to be unpleasant, but some might).  The spice level on the Pepperoni and Original Wild flavors were perfect. The Original Wild was medium hot, so it might be a little too much for some.  I loved it though.  I recommend that people try to buy this locally before spending a lot of money on it.  I bought mine from a local vegan store online, then discovered that a large grocery chain carries it in their health food section.

I know we pay more for individually packaged food items, and it's not the most environmentally friendly way to buy products, but it's so convenient to carry a couple of those bags of almonds that I don't mind overlooking the price and the extra packaging.  Love them on the go or when I travel.

ADVANTAGES:  (1)These clams taste quite good.  (2)The can is easy to open with a can opener.  (3)Just as oysters are an extremely, extremely rich source of zinc, clams are an extremely, extremely rich source of iron.  (4)Clams are low in mercury and other marine pollutants.  (5)Clams contain a small amount of the long-chain omega-3 fatty acids, EPA and DHA, which have been shown to prevent many human diseases.  (6)At less than $2.00 per can, the price is right.  (7)The quantity of clams in each can is adequately good.  DISADVANTAGES:  (1)Approximately 1 to 2 clams in each can will have sand in them or be attached to shell fragments.

I was sceptical, but this stuff is great. It not "quite" peanut butter, but it close enough. Unlike some other peanut spread products I've tried which were entirely unpalatable this stuff makes a fine PB2&J sandwich for under 150 cals (low cal bread and sugar free jelly).

I have difficulty controlling portion size when I eat peanut butter, which wrecks my diet, and is preventing me from losing the last 20 lbs. I need to lose. After trying the revolting Walden Farms 0 Calorie Peanut Spread, several Amazon users recommended this product. PB 2 is real peanut butter in powdered form. It's had most of the fat extracted from the peanuts. It contains just three ingredients: peanuts, salt, and sugar. It's more natural than many regular PB brands. Each 2 tbsp. serving contains 45 calories and just 1.5 g of fat (compared to 190 or 200 calories and 16 g of fat in regular PB). You mix one to two tbsp of water per two tbsp of PB2. This is one of the few diet foods that tastes the same as the regular stuff, instead of being an inferior chemical tasting imitation of the original. I mix it with sugar free syrup and spread it on an apple for a 115 calorie dessert that tastes awesome!

I've tried this low-sodium variety and it had a surprisingly "peppery" taste that I did not care for. Also, you can reduce the sodium content of other flavors by only using half or two-thirds of the seasoning packet. You will get more flavor, but end up consuming as much sodium - sometimes even less, depending on the variety - than you would if you ate this low-sodium kind with its entire seasoning packet.

Ramen has an unfair bad reputation. Use less of the seasoning, add some leftover frozen vegetables, maybe toss in pieces of leftover chicken or cooked bacon, and you've gotten a decent small meal. I'm not saying that you should live off of Ramen only, but Ramen recipes have gotten my husband and I through some financially-tough months in the past.

Ordered their 6 month Frequent Flower club subscription off of Amazon.  Wasn't sure what I was going to get but had some points I needed to use to I went ahead and ordered 6 months.  I was very impressed by the quantity and the quality of the flowers.  Each month I received a variety of flowers, two bouquets, sometimes two similar ones, sometimes they were different.  There were so many flowers I divided them up and made arrangements for the kitchen, the dining room table and even small arrangements in the bathrooms.  They're super fresh and come with several packets of preservative so as long as you change the water and cut them mine typically lasted at least 10 days looking super fresh.  This is my first month without them, I'm going to reorder another 6 months subscription because I really have missed them this month.  I'd highly recommend them!

This product had an unannounced ingredient change. Chicken was added, which caused huge problems for my dog. The representative at Purina wrote back in response to my upset email to advise me they only changed the ingredients to the canned EN. Totally false statement. I had written down the 1st few ingredients in the beginning and I made a comparison when my dog got sick. Totally unacceptable!
This was a very good product! I loved it and would highly recommend it to anyone!! I plan on ordering more when I can.

ARrived in timely manner, as advertised. Chips are very crunchy, good as dippers, especially with hummus, or just by themselves. The chips had a few more broken pieces than the bags you buy in the grocery store, but for the money you save, the on-line purchase is definitely worth it. Will repeat order in future.

Bought this pancake mix previously. This is NOT banana macadamia nut pancake mix. It is banana macadamia nut FLAVOR pancake mix. The only place you see that in the product listing is if you look carefully at the item picture, and they even turn the bag sideways in the picture to make the word "Flavor" less obvious.

If you're in to artificial flavors, go for it. I'll keep shopping elsewhere for the real thing.

Our German Shepherd and Golden Retriever love Mighty Dog.
I served it to my other German Shepherd for 13 years and
for several years for the Shepherd before her. I don't
think you can go wrong with this product, they really
love the pulled beef and pulled pork too! Would recommend.

The great news is I haven't gotten sick!

Unfortunately after a couple months of drinking this product daily I've not felt a huge change either... I've moved on to trying Amazing Grass which has been supplementing my daily vegi intake that I wasn't getting and has had more dramatic effects on my health. I've switched from this product to taking two tablets of Lifesheild mushroom blend at night. Overall I've seemed to have missed my yearly 3 day (or so) crippling sickness

Good will hunting,
Tom

I hope Amazon changes the heading from 30 to 80 count; this price for 30 count would be ridiculous.

My doctor directed switching from coffee to tea. He is no longer my physician but I began with Twinnings Irish and English breakfast teas; finally, I found Bewley's. My breakfast tea style emerged into drinking one batch of 2 bags of Irish breakfast tea, for its strength, followed by using one bag of English breakfast tea an hour later. Today I use Dublin morning tea-bags, 2 then 1 of course. It falls in between these two breakfast tea types, slightly milder than Irish but perceptibly stronger than English...and still smooth.

The physician made an erroneous assumption about my coffee habit. I had only been drinking 6 ounces every morning, for years; occasionally decaf cappuccino after dinner. He probably would have not recommended the switch to tea. I am happy to have found a strong excellent tea, and have been on Bewley's for a year. It is smoother and stronger than Twinnings, in my opinion, and about the same price. A winner all around.

If you drink your coffee as espresso, cappuccino, or french press, you will appreciate this strong smooth tea.

I found a link to the tofu shirataki in an article on MSN.com talking about foods to stay away from.  Of course they weren't talking about staying away from the tofu shirataki noodles, but to steer clear on pasta, even whole wheat, claiming it to be a glorified junk food that quickly turns to sugar once digested.  Being Italian and an avid pasta fan, I quickly "googled" and found a link to Amazon.com on www.house-foods.com.  I ordered 5 packages of the noodles, because I have been eating health food for awhile and despite the poor reviews, I was ready to give these a shot.  I am so glad that I did.  They are like tough spaghetti.  By tough I do not mean, tire rubber, but more like over cooked.  That doesn't bother me at all.  I cooked them in marinara sauce, put them in broth and made an Asian style soup and served them with teriyaki chicken.  These things are so versatile and fabulous.  I am on weight watchers and an entire bag of these noodles has 0 points and only 40 calories with 4 grams of fiber.  You can't ask for a better alternative to pasta.  The expiration date is about 4 months from when you order, so you don't have to gobble them up immediately. It also makes stocking up more convenient.  I will be stocking up on these indefinitely!  My only complaint is that shipping is kinda high, but I guess they do have to be cold packed to stay fresh.

THE DESCRIPTION OF THE PRODUCT LEAVES ALOT TO BE DESIRED. THE NOODLES WERE DISGUSTING. IF I HAD KNOWN THEY WERE SHIPPED IN LIQUID AND NEEDED TO BE REFRIGERATED, I WOULD NEVER HAVE PURCHASED THEM. THEY HAVE NO FLAVOR AND THE TEXTURE IS DISGUSTING. I NOW HAVE THREE PACKS OF NOODLES SITTING IN MY REFRIGERATOR THAT I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO DO WITH. CONSIDERING HOW EXPENSIVE THE SHIPPING COST WAS, I WILL BE THROWING MY MONEY DOWN THE DRAIN. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT. MY HUSBAND AND I LOVE THE VEGAN WAY OF LIFE. THIS PRODUCT IS GARBAGE.

Color me happy when I found this product . Amazon has a vast selection of condiments that are so great. These packets travel great and are wonderful when going on a picnic. No more taking those huge jars and worrying about keeping it cold. This is a life saver. Hikers also like this procuct fits just great in their backpack.

Yorn desh born, der ritt de gitt der gue, Orn desh, dee born desh, de umn børk! børk! børk!

Hoo tu meke-a der svedeesh meetenballen:

Furst yer teke-a zee meet und edd zee tempu svedeesh meetballen meex. Yuoo meex it up-uer reelee reelee guud - sqooeeshy sqooeeshy - und meke-a intu der meetanballen. Cuuk zeem up in der freiyee pun - check zeem oon der flooree - buooncy, buooncy!

Tempu meex mekes zee feenest svedeesh meetballen!

These treats look like chicken, smell like chicken, and contain only chicken. There are other chicken tenders on the market that do not smell or look like chicken so I doubt they really contain chicken.

My dog loves them. Sometimes I take them to the dog park to share. I have yet to met a dog that does not like these treats.

If you are looking for an energy bar with genuine nutritional value, look no further.

The bars are compact, delicious and easy to digest.

I never received the product.  When I contacted the vendor, they offered no assistance.  They instructed me to contact FedEx.  I informed them that I did and FedEx deals only with the shipper.  They still did not offer assistance, refund or another shipment.

I ordered the blue non pareils, and they were not the same shade of blue shown in the picture.  The real color is a bit lighter and maybe more "aqua."  When sprinkled on white frosting, they did look a bit darker.  So, they worked for what I need, but the color was still disappointing...

I'm a fan of regular rice Krispies, but this cereal is something gone horribly wrong.  It is much too sweet and has a really bad flavor to it - I'm not really sure how to describe it.  I'm a fan of lucky charms, cookie crisp, etc .. but I just can not eat this stuff.

This licorice is very much like Twizzlers or Red Vines in texture, which I like. It is chewy without being too much so and not sticky. The flavor is good. It is distinctive without being overpowering, and no aftertaste.

I normally don't care what my candy is made of or how many calories it has. After all, it is candy. I don't expect any healthy ingredients. However, since Newman's is promoting the organic aspects of the product I decided to comment on them. While the brand is "Newman's Own Organics," only three of the eleven ingredients in the product are organic. The rest are conventional. At least there are no artificial colors or flavors. Calorie-wise, Newman's comes off slightly better at 3.1 calories/gram vs. 3.6 for Twizzlers and Red Vines.

While the foil packaging may keep the candy fresh on the shelf, once opened there is no way to reseal the package. In all fairness, though, neither Red Vines nor Twizzler packages can be resealed after opening.

When comparing 5 oz. packages of all three products here on Amazon, you find Newman's costs over twice as much as Twizzlers and over 2.5 times more than Red Vines. Twizzlers and Red Vines are made in the USA and Newman's are made in Mexico.

For me, licorice is an occasional treat. Therefore, if I am in the market and craving a licorice type candy, I would probably reach for these, price not withstanding. I like the pomegranate flavor, and I think I would give the black licorice flavor a try as well.
This is a wonderful tea.  But yes, it's expensive.  I wish it came by the pound, so I could afford it daily.
The product came quickly and was a great sized bottle. Unopened and in new shape. Will definitly use them again for my baking needs.

I used to buy this gravy often when the ingredients matched those listed above. I recently ordered a case (for myself and to share with friends) because I could no longer find it locally. The ingredients have changed and now milk is listed as a "natural flavoring." The allergy information has been changed to read: Wheat, Milk. HUGE disappointment!
Received product on time as promised in excellent condition.  Product is a delight to use in my gourmet dishes; adds a whole new level of flavor.

We are chip fanatics in our house and we decided to try these because of their claim of being a "healthier" alternative to regular chips. I will admit that they have a great crunch - something between a ricecake and a kettle chip. The texture is also very nice, again - similar to a ricecake, but with a great potato flavor. The big issue with these is the sodium level. After about four or five chips they're almost unbearable because of the salt and you really stop tasting anything but the salt. A review of the nutritional facts showed that the sodium per serving was almost double that of a standard potato chip serving and that was for their "original" flavor...I can't imagine what the "Salt & Pepper" style must be like.

I would buy these regularly if they cut the salt by about 75%. Because of the salt factor, I don't think you can call these a "healthy" alternative to chips.

I have tried all of the flavors of Popchips and the Original is my favorite.  You know those chips Munchos that you get at convenience stores?  Well, these kind of remind me of them but they are: 1) tastier, 2) less salty, 3) less processed tasting and 4) better for you.  These are great snacking chips, good with dip, but definitely great on their own.  Crunchy and delicious!  If you like potato chips, you will definitely like Popchips.  Only thing that is weird is that some of the bags are saltier than others - I am not sure why.

Great tasting BBQ Chips. Going to buy more.

At first, looking at the size of the bags, and just thinking about the concept of "Popped chips" I was on the fence. Glad I finally made up my mind.

My only complaint is, that these bags are so small. I want to purchase a regular size bag. Maybe a box of six or something. Because if you buy in bulk you save. Having to buy a box of 24... all that extra packaging is going to cost you.

I only had the BBQ flavor since the variety pack was OOS at the time I ordered. This was the first time I ate these and they are much better than I expected. I read the reviews and saw that it got a lot of praises, but still skeptical since people's taste buds aren't the same. Once I received it, tried a bag and these are great. They aren't greasy at all and pack a lot of flavor. I rather eat these whenever I feel like I need a snack than original potatoes chips or something that's a bit greasy.

Either way, these are great. Go to their website and see if you can find a vendor near you. Buy a bag to try out and if you love it, just keep getting more from your retail store or buy 'em cheaper here on Amazon!

After my vet recommended switching from the basic Petsmart variety lo quality dry food, I tried Wellness canned cat food (even though the price was at least 3 times more expensive than the old Pro Plan). My one cat would regularly throw up immediately following a meal of Pro Plan dry food. The results now are that my cat has not thrown up in the 3 weeks since he has been on this food. I trust my vet and will continue to feed this food. My local Food Co-Op carries this food and it is cheaper than the vet's price. My cat's health is important to me.
I switch between the chicken and the salmon varieties. My 4 cats get 1/2 can(of a 5.5 ounce can) each - a day, plus, I also give them 3 tablespoons of the Wellness dry food a day. Try it for a month and you will be pleased with the results!
the tea is very good with honey and I have seen a difference. I have lost 3lbs since taking it.

I have long been a fan of Lindt bars, and this one was no exception, although I do agree with another reviewer that most of the flavoring of this particular bar comes from sugar (19 grams, or about 1.5 tablespoons per serving!) and milk.  I was especially disappointed, though, to discover that this bar contains "artificial flavoring".  Read the label.  Apparently, some of their other products do as well.  Such a disappointment from what I thought was a gourmet chocolatier.

I had wanted to try this popcorn for a long time, finally treated myself to some. It is pretty good, but I add a dollop of butter and a small amount of popcorn salt to the pan before it pops. I probably won't buy it again because I can make better popcorn from scratch myself.
my wife and i find senseo always consistent in flavor and taste.. we have traveled all over the world and we feel the best is in a cup of senseo dark roast coffee...long may senseo be available

I use Senseo coffees at least twice a day. We have several flavor and roast varieties. Senseo is a Dutch roast coffee but the pads are made in Belgium. The medium blend is a very good tasting coffee and just right for me. This is the pad we use most often, and when making two cups at a time in the Senseo machine, we combine one medium roast with one decaf pad.... gives us a half-caf cup with great body and flavor.

Reading the other reviews, I wonder whether I got a stale box! My tea tasted bland and even dusty. I couldn't taste the slightest bergamot. It was like something you would drink when you're camping in the boonies and it's raining and you have no other way to heat up. Like something out of one of those giant yellow Igloo dispensers you see at tailgate parties on foggy November mornings. I would rather drink hot water. After I tried this, I dumped out my mug and threw the box and its 15 remaining organic tannin packets into the compost! Ashes to ashes.

i have 26 african violets, i was losing alot of leaves due to thrips and a few had cyclemen mites. i used these 2in1 fert/pesticide spikes in all of them, and now (3 wks later) i no longer lose any leaves and my violets are now healthy and growing strong. i've tried everything on the market to rid my violets of the pests but nothing worked until now. these spikes are great! but you have to wait for them to work, so don't give up on them, just when i thought they were not working, i saw a big improvement so give them time. i gave them 4 stars because you have to wait for results.
My husband and I thought we would try a different "high test" coffee.  It wasn't as good and had a different finish to it.  We are sticking with the Jet Fuel!

I got the Keurig coffeemaker for Christmas.  Was skeptical that it could brew a cup of coffee strong enough for my taste.  After trying all the k-cup samples that came with the maker I decided that the extra bold k-cups were strong, but not quite what I was looking for.  Started reading reviews and decided on Black Tiger.  Found what I was looking for.  Great taste, not bitter, strong enough for me (the largest size brew is not strong enough, but the next size down is perfect).  Highly recommend this k-cup.

I often find cookies way too sweet. These are WONDERFUL. Sweet, but not TOO sweet.  They are delicious.  However, I agree--don't buy them on Amazon, that is an AWFUL price.  You can get several more boxes if you just go to the grocery store.
I loved nestles diet (low cal) hot chocolate with marshmellows. It was only 30 or 35 calories. Have they stopped making it??? Can not find it anywhere. It was the best!
These chips are great with tzatziki and hummus. They are very light but actually taste like lentils.  I highly recommend them.

tastes fantastic, but a little too much fat (3g/serving)

at trader's joe available with 2.5gms fat.

but really need to be under 2 gms fat.

The delivery was extremely quick, the packaging was fine, and if you suck off all the honey, the almonds even taste pretty good. but i for one do not like this flavor. Mind you, I could eat 3095826 honey roasted PEANUTS.

The chocolate was outstanding. The service was quick. The value of the product exceeded what I paid. I'm very satisfied. This is my second
purchase of candy from Amazon.com and I will do it again.
I love these sunflower seeds. I found them up when I was out of town and loved them so much, I had to order more online. These are a pretty good price and so tasty! These are by far my favorite!

I have been drinking the Cafe Altura French Roast for a long time-the price is great and the beans are top quality--no quakers--the little shrivelled ones that Cook's Illustrated showed cause that truck stop coffee taste. The French Roast does seem to make a huge mess when I grind it--lots of static, and the Columbian Dark Roast doesn't. Best of all, though, is that the flavor of the Columbian Dark Roast is just as rich and low acid, without any "burned" taste. It has a rich complexity missing from other dark roasts. Yum yum!

This is great coffee.  I am a coffee purist.  I don't add cream or sugar (unless it is weak or bitter). I truly enjoy coffee.  I have tried many different types of coffee for K-cups.  This is my new favorite. The price was amazing too.  Very smooth and subtle hazelnut flavor, not overpowering.

I received this as a gift and I'm thankful for the thought but really glad I didn't waste my own money on this stuff. It's terrible. Carnation cocoa from a paper package is way better by comparison. I love chocolate and this stuff is watery and flavorless. Don't waste your money.

Another great Numi tea, having had Numi many times before I knew I'd love this one and was THRILLED to see it as a gold box deal(what a steal amazon thank you!). The best mint tea is the fresh kind but this is so good you might not noticed the difference!

I buy this snack for my home, it's delicious! My family loves it! It's low calorie, gluten free, non gmo and tastes delicious! Perfect snack to take on family vacations, give to the kids for school, and munch on while watching a movie! 24 count is great! Ensures that we're always stocked!

I have bought this particular xylitol gum but never questioned as to where it was made.  If it is made in China, I give it zero stars because one has to be concerned about poisons they have found in many other things made in China like dog food, cat food, jewelry, tooth paste, baby formula, and more.  I avoid anything made in China as China manufacturers only care about profits.  They have no regard at all for people as long as they make money. I suspect this may be garbage made in China because the price is awfully low, which is a tell-tale sign it was made in China.

A blind taste test was conducted among three members of the family ranging from 8 to 49 years of age. We used Poland Spring bottled water and Essentia 9.5 ph water, both cooled to identical temperatures. No family member was able to tell the difference in taste. Comments ranged from, "It's water, right?" to "Did you put the same thing in both glasses?" So...it looks and tastes like water.

We next tested the pH using materials drawn from a 40 year old Gilbert Chemistry set. Remarkably, the Essentia water was, in fact, between pH 9 and 10, quite a bit more alkaline than the Poland Spring or tap water, both of which proved to be neutral in pH. A phenolpthalein solution turned pink when mixed with Essentia water but remained clear with both the Poland Spring and tap water.

A MedLine search did not reveal any evidence for studies that have definitively identified health benefits of alkaline water. One study indicated that patients with metabolic acidosis due to renal failure may benefit from alkaline water, but human studies are still necessary to demonstrate any real value.

Some individuals may enjoy using this water to mix with concentrated orange juice for a low-acid product. Drinking it alongside a high-acid meal such as a meal containing tomato sauce may reduce heartburn/reflux. Your mileage may vary. Otherwise, I'd be concerned about the potential negative impact of drinking large quantities of alkaline pH water without neutralizing it in advance. I don't see that any long term studies have been conducted to demonstrate safety of high volume intake of alkaline water.

But for occasional use, this tastes just like any other bottled water.

Essentia is purified water with a 9.5pH. What makes this water different from others on the market are the electrolytes. I conducted a taste test with my teenage boys to compare regular bottled water with Essentia. They loved the light, fresh taste of the Essentia water. They thought it tasted clean and refreshing. Compared to regular bottled water, this water is much smoother. It is purified by reverse osmosis which is a filtration method that removes large molecules and ions from solutions. The boys also liked the size of the bottle. Overall, they preferred the Essentia water. I would definitely recommend it.

I tried both the Mango Peach and the Peach Tea Mio flavors and while I liked them both, I definitely prefer the Peach Tea. The Mango Peach is just TOO sweet for my taste, providing a flavor that tastes a little too much like Peach flavored sugar water. The Mango should even the flavor out but it doesn't. This flavor is best when your water is ice cold (as in full of ice). The closer to room temperature your water gets the sweeter the flavor gets and more difficult to drink. And this review comes from someone who used very little (one squirt). My husband likes it better than I do, but he also adds 4 packets of sweetener to his coffee.

I've tried this flavor of MIO, as well as the strawberry watermelon, and my main reaction to both has been that the flavor is not natural tasting and is far too sweet.  MIO mixed with water creates a flavor not unlike a kids' juice drink, which is not something I prefer.  The taste is sticky sweet and very artificial.  Obviously, something like this is highly subjective, so I'm sure many people love it...it's just not my style.  I will say that MIO is very convenient.  The packaging is small and easy to keep in a desk at work, for instance, or a purse.  Also, there is no need to really stir the liquid, so it has an advantage over Crystal Light or other similar powder products.  Nonetheless, I would need to see major flavor changes before I would buy this again.

For a tiny little container, MIO includes quite a bang for the buck! The most important factor, of course, is taste and everyone in my family loves this flavor. We can add it to tea or lemonade or simply enjoy it in a chilled glass of water. In winter, it is the perfect addition to yogurt or oatmeal, adding variety to these basic products.

Soft drinks can take up space and the packages can be difficult to lug but even those with limited space can find room for a MIO container. We have a small desk organizer with several MIO containers neatly arranged in a row. The organizer takes up about 6 inches or less, front to back, in a cabinet, and even less width-wise. Compare that to the space required by soft drinks.

If you like to have something on hand to add to water while working, this is convenient to keep in a desk drawer and eliminates the noise of a pop can being opened in a shared office space.

I purchased these organic lollipops in the 30-ounce container for my baby shower so that the attending parents could read the ingredients on the label. Needless to say, everyone was happy, including all the children and adults. These lollipops are the perfect size for little ones!

It's really hard to believe Amazon is selling this stuff.

No kidding, on the lid it says "Best by Sept '06." These things are stale, soft - stinky.

Out they go!

Amazon should take their inventory and turn this stuff into hog feed.

We use these as an after dinner treat for patrons leaving our restaurant and adults and kids both really enjoy them! Sure, it's a sugar filled treat, but i do like the fact that it's organic; I don't know if the organic quality has much bearing on our customers, but they certainly enjoy them!

These are excellent.  I wish the company would charge more and put six bars in a box but when you've got a good product you can do whatever you want.  I will be a repeat buyer. Dairy free and Almond butter YUM.

... but it would be desecration to put this gunk on any decent pasta, let alone Rustichella's. Jarred pesto is to freshly-made pesto as instant coffee is to freshly-brewed mocha-java from Peet's. I've been silly enough to try various brands of pesto in jars, and none of them would glean more than two stars. The frozen brands are marginally better, but the only justification for store-shelf pesto is the unavailability of fresh basil, Even then, you'd do better to make a pesto recipe with any soft herb you have: arugula, dandelion, parsley, mashed artichoke ... if I lived in Nunavut I'd probably use lichen from the belly of a caribou rather than depend on jarred pesto.

Here's a basic pesto recipe for a small batch:

50g of basil leaves
Extra virgin olive oil
6 Tbsp grated Parmigiano Reggiano or Grana Padano
2 Tbsp Pecorino (romano, toscano, sardo or siciliano)
2 cloves of garlic
1 Tbsp pine nuts
Coarse sea salt
The traditional method uses a wooden pestle and a marble mortar. Start by pounding the garlic and salt until you get a smooth paste.
Add the basil, a handful at a time, and keep grinding until each batch of the leaves is incorporated. To preserve the essential oils in the basil, don't be too rough with it.
Add the pine nuts and grind some more.
Add the cheese and mix well.
Add the oil, little by little, until the pesto has the right consistency - a matter of taste.
Serve with pasta or added to minestrone. The recommended pastas are troffie, trofiette or trenette, but it goes with just about any pasta. I usually serve it with spaghetti or linguine.

If somebody has an interesting variation, post it as a comment.
I have always raised my Chihuahuas on Science Diet Small bite adult canine Maintenance from one year of age on throughout adulthood.

Purchased this on the advice of Dr. Mark Hyman, the well known author. I take a tablespoon or two with a glass of water right after breakfast and again after dinner and it keeps things moving, especially when eating a diet that's high in protein and low in fiber. Any other health benefits that come with it are bonuses as far as I'm concerned.
I'm in my late 60's & I find it gives me a boost when I need one. There are days I wouldn't get anything done without it.  Used properly, it's great, DON'T ABUSE IT!

This is good pasta for those who have gluten problems. Cooking this was a tough job at first because at usual heat for pasta this becomes a starchy paste in 1/2 the time. So i actually wasted two packets before searching google to learn "how to cook corn pasta?". The key is very low heat with lots of stirring. But It turned out to be good and tasty finally
always like this cookies i used to get then from kellogs store but they closed up and sent me a letter telling me i could get from amazon  glad they did

I love Keurig coffee and this is an excellent mix of flavors. Keurig coffee is so much better than regular coffee. I find myself a lot more awake in the mornings from these yummy and just bold enough flavors. :)

I was really looking forward to trying different brands and flavors of coffee but this assortment was 90% Green Mountain and 75% some type of vanilla.  It included 4 Blueberry (haven't tried that yet but not really happy about it).  I get the impression that you get about 4 or 5 of a good variety and then a handful each of whatever flavors don't sell very well.  Luckily I'm okay with all the vanilla but this definitely was not a "variety" pack.

I've bought these cookies from my local store and they are hands down the best organic sandwich cookie.  All other brands of organic sandwich cookies come no where near on taste and texture.  I always get this brand now.

This is good stuff. I love to drink it and relax. No hangover next day, nice sleeping. Not sweet.

I drink this now frequent and it is just an incredible product. Will purchase more.
I like these because they are not too big, so the bag lasts a little longer. My dogs love them. Price is pretty reasonable too.

These Kippers are very tasty the flavor compares to Appel Kippers only the consistency is compared to the big meaty Appel Kippers slightly mushy this varies from can to can on the ones I have eaten so far. That being said the price is so good I intend to continue to purchase these as they are great in a salad or anything along those lines.

Really great smoked flavor not a hint of fishiness. If you have a taste for kippers give these a try the price is downright cheap for the quality. If you have never tried kippers you may be in for a treat.

I have turned several folks onto Kippers who have never had any smoked fish or some lousy stuff and most of them complained of the aroma when I was eating Kippers (especially at breakfast) but once they actually ate some suddenly they converted on the spot.

These are second on my list of Kippers behind Appel but for the price difference it is a no-brainier to grab some of these Polar Kipper Snacks at about a buck and a quarter a can, wow what a bargain.

Bottom Line: High Quality for a Low Price.

I have been ordering polar kippers on autoship from amazon for some time. Makes a quick and easy breakfast for me, and has served as a good substitute for breakfast bacon for me. While they still have fat, they are good fats. the smoky and salty flavor satisfy my taste at the same time. I eat a whole can which is supposed to be two servings, but even then it comes to a total of 162 calories.

I have had on occasional problem with a lid not coming off cleanly but it wasn't a big deal to work around. Also some cans will vary slightly in the contents but it all averages out, especially when you eat them on a regular basis as I do.

Buying on autoship is the cheapest way by far to get kippers with free shipping I am usually around $1.10 or so a can vs. $1.50+ in my local grocery. Plus I get a regular supply which fits nicely into my every other day or so diet plan.

This is one of my husband's favorite teas.  I wish it weren't so expensive, but it does last a long time.  I bought an 8 ounce bag and received 4 separate 2 ounce bags, which is quite a waste of packaging.

I have been suffering from IBS for a while now and this tea is the only thing that works for me when I am having cramps. I think IBS is a very personal problem and non of us have the same issues and solutions as the next person. For me fennel in general has been a great relief and I like Heather's tea bags because they taste good, they smell good and there are enough seeds in each tea bag to prepare tea in a big mug. I also tried their soluble fiber and that was a great product as well. Overall I recommend Heather's products and especially this tea if you are on the d-IBS side and need relief from cramps associated with it.

I have had mild IBS all of my adult life...  I drink this tea all day and it has eliminated the bloated feeling and gas.  It is the ONLY thing that got me through Christmas. With all the holiday foods around, it allowed me to indulge a little and survive without having to "pay the piper". It is certainly an acquired taste, which you might not like if you do not favor licorice.  It really helps bloating if you use it on a regular basis even if you don't have IBS...

Delish!

I've been using it on ham sandwiches...but would also be good for chicken or pork dishes. Can't get enough of this stuff!

The taste it's OK, it will just pick up other flavors in the dish but is a fantastic option for dieters. Just replace your diner mael with a bag of these with some veggies and tell me after one week.... For a great tasting meal, add one teaspon of peanut butter. DELICIOUS!!!!! but it will add about 100-200 calories to the dish which is a lot. I only recommend this variation very ocasionally, otherwise you won't loose weight. I buy this product in bulk from Konjac.

First off, this soup will fill you up well because of the beans and rice. But I can't get over the sour flavor that
this soup has. It has lime in it so I figure that is what I am tasting, but its too much lime flavor and it gets in the way of the spices that are otherwise very good in this soup.

Not so sure I'll order this one again but I might try a different flavor from the same company.

I've eaten these rice sides for probably 10 years or more now, and this Cheddar Broccoli variety used to be my favorite.  Unfortunately, a while back, Knorr bought out the Lipton line of rice products and subsequently proceeded to cut costs in any way possible to make more money.  This has unfortunately resulted in the previously quite cheesy rice dish being reduced to a shadow of its former self.  I bought a box of these because I hadn't had them in a while, and because the Chicken and Broccoli variety still holds up well enough only to discover that the new mix results in a very wet cheese sauce (after cooking in the microwave according to the package directions) that is considerably less cheesy than one would expect.  Eventually enough of the sauce will evaporate/soak into the rice & pasta mixture to increase the flavor a bit, but I can't recommend it anymore.  It's become thoroughly average in every respect.
The best water I have ever tasted.  no one else comes close.  Not all bottled water is created equally.  Don't buy the cheap stuff.  Tastes like night and day.

If you love smooth, rich dark chocolate, and you also love ginger, the combination will astound you.  This is one of the best chocolate bars I've ever had, hands down.  Each piece is worth savoring, slowly...
I tried everything and my cats didnt bother with it. They let the stuff rot inside.

The syrup is very thick and sweet.  Too thick, in my opinion - it feels like it should be watered down with about 1 part water added for every 3 parts syrup to make it a better consistency.  Probably works great for snow cones where you want it to stick to the ice chunks, but for shave ice, it needs to percolate down, and it doesn't.  So you're constantly adding more.  And it's not just the flavor that's too concentrated - the color is too.  My 4 year old had blue lips for 2 days after eating shave ice with the blue raspberry syrup on it.  For reference, our preferred brand is Hawaiian Snow (substantially superior taste, IMO, but you have to order it from Hawaii and mix it yourself), and the staining only lasts a few hours, or until the next meal.  It's OK, hence the 3 stars, and we'll probably use it up eventually, but I don't think I will buy more.
Purchased as a gift. My sister-in-law is a baker and ordered these for her to go in a cupcake accessory box. She loved these.

REALLY ENJOY THE 'SNAPPY GINGER' TASTE IN MI-DEL GLUTEN-FREE GINGER SNAPS.
THIS CASE SEEMED TO ONLY HAVE ABOUT 5-8 WHOLE, IN TACT COOKIES IN EACH PACKAGE. THEY WERE MOSTLY GINGER SNAP CRUMBS!
I HAVE ORDERED THESE GLUTEN-FREE COOKIES OFTEN AND THE MOSTLY CRUMBS WAS A FIRST. I HAVE BEEN PLEASED WITH OTHER MI-DEL GLUTEN-FREE COOKIES I HAVE ORDERED IN THE PAST.
HAVEN'T DECIDED IF I WILL ORDER A CASE OF THEM AGAIN.
My partner only eats white chocolate.  It's difficult to find GOOD white chocolate to satisfy his tastes.  He says this is the best he's ever had.  I'll re-buy every Christmas!

I first bought these biscuits in a specialty store in another town.  My dog loves them!  I could not find them where I live.  I found them here and get them on line now for a better price.  I highly recommend them.  My dog cannot have any sweet because of her tendency toward diabetic like symptoms.  These are healthy and tasty and have NO molasses in them.  Every biscuit now a days has molasses.  WHY?  These biscuits make us BOTH happy!

I see alot of people slamming this product for using other than baking needs,and I guess I can understand if you are cutting this powder with 2-1 water and trying to scramble!However,if you try using milk(I actually use powdered milk as well,but thats your call),and just add a tiny little bit of liquid at a time until you get to the consistency you need,and make sure to butter the pan(use a little oil as well to keep butter from burning),you will find this item is NOT as bad as all that scrammbled,it is however,hard as heck to try amd make an omlet out of this stuff,but add a few other items,green peppers,onions,selentro,spices,etc,and you will find they arent all that bad,they definately are NOT farm fresh eggs,but no-one ever cliamed they were,just cut WAY back on the liquid to powder ratio,and cook it SLOWLY using a buttered luke warm pan,bring it up to medium to medium low temp stirring constantly until done,you will find yourself liking this stuff,just my opinion,but give it one more shot using milk or powdered milk,and only tiny bits at a time,and you may be surprised!

The Asian Pear nails you with an overwhelming aroma and not much improved flavor; I love Asian Pears but didn't find these comparable. Same with the Fuji apples, which taste..just..old. The strawberries and bananas are clearly the best, but still have a slight off taste to them.
PS Snagged 'em @ Costco...For cheaper, but the same product, of course.
BTW: Last time I checked, that's not what an Asian Pear looks like, box.

My Golden LOVES these! Although they are (my opinion) a little pricey I believe them to be a good investment. They are a hard biscuit so they help with keep his teeth clean and also they have glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate in them which is good for his joints. I can't find them anywhere locally so I have to order online. I haven't found a lot of difference in the actual cost of the product but I've found Amazon gives me the best rate on the shipping and overall is the best deal.
This product totally reminds me of Lipton Lemon ice tea. It was really really good. Makes for a good sleep and relaxation aid.

I thought this was a Jamaican blend or roast, but turns out it's simply a heavily flavored coffee.  The flavor tastes artificial - like fake maple syrup flavoring.  We have three coffee drinkers in our house and none of us could get past the first few sips.  Now I have to find a home for the rest of it so it doesn't go to waste.
Taste is okay.  Not blown away.  Hidden is the fact that this is truly a decaffeinated coffee.  Only place to find this out is on the bottom of the box.  Not what I want first thing in the morning.

I had been interested in making my own salad dressing and after trying Napa Garden's Salad Dressing Mix, I highly recommend it. I made the salad dressing recipe included on the label and it is very good. It improves as it has time to infuse the flavors in the oil and vinegar.  Later, I cooked some summer squash in a light drizzle of the dressing and they tasted great.
I bought this for a gift for my father and he loved it.  The only down side is the price.  I will only get these as gifts and not as a food staple due to the cost.

In my hunt for good strong decaf, I've tried many. This is the best, alongside Tetley. I actually drink a 14 ounce cup in the morning using one bag of Tetley decaf and one bag of Ty-phoo. One would be hard pressed to guess it was full decaf. I'm throwing out my PG Tips. After forty-or-so cups, I've given it a good trial, but it's just too "green" for me. Sticking with this one...just placed another order. Ty-phoo is strong, with no weird designer tea flavors added, and no off-tastes. As close to the caffeinated tea you really want to drink as you will get.
Very nice sugar substitute, and great that we can get it via web purchase, since it is not available in stores.  Thanks, Amazon!

I love sensational flavors and these almonds really deliver.
They get sprinkled on many of my Thai dishes, stir fries, and fried rice medleys for extra crunch, calcium, fiber, and protein.
The price for 12 oz of these cookies is absurd. They are good, but not worth the money. Buy them at Costco (24 oz bags) for less!!
The cans arrived undamaged and the contents are delicious. This cream makes wonderful frozen pina colada's and I am glad I bought the case. It will just last the summer!

...about this water as everyone else. To me, it tastes a bit like unsweetened mouthwash. I guess I was just expecting something different. I've only tried the Spearmint so far, and I've noticed in another review that this one is not a favorite...a bit scared to try the others though in that I'm not very enthusiastic about my first one...
My 2 boxers loved these bones. The only negative is that the bones don't last long. My dogs ate them up in 1 day....better stock up!
If you enjoy  drinking tea in the morning or most any time during the day, this product is very good.  I recommend it highly.

My baby enjoys this product & eats it regularly.  Though when I ordered it online it froze during the shipping process (we live in MT).  This changed the texture from thick & creamy to more chunky & brothy.  She didn't like it as much & I actually threw the last several out.  So I don't reconmend freezing.

The manufacturer of this product needs to significantly improve their quality control of bottling this product. I received my first two jars of this yesterday and this morning as I opened the first jar the lid would not unscrew. When I forced it to open I saw that the stevia had not been properly sealed beneath the lid and the powder had filled the screw top and even spilled out into the plastic casing around it. Naturally since the seal had been compromised I was unable to use the contents of that jar. I opened the second jar and it was properly sealed and the taste of the contents was quite good. Unfortunately I will not be able to purchase this anymore because I have lost faith with the manufacturer's quality control and because it is a food product Amazon cannot accept returns. I am adding this note to tell all that when Amazon found out about the defective jar, they sent me an email informing me that they are mailing me a free replacement of the entire order and it has already shipped on the same say I notified them. Now who can complain about that?

I've tried a few brands of truffle oil and I really haven't been able to tell the difference between qualities. All are super pungent with that lovely aroma and taste that truffle oil brings. I used this on salads and also to oven bake/fry potato chips (recipe to follow). The price is great which is why I bought it. Truffle oil can get pricey quick. Depending on how often you use it, it is great to find a economical source! Love this stuff!

Potato Chips:

Ingredients:
* 2 baking potatoes thinly sliced on a mandolin
* Garlic powder
* Salt
* Pepper
* Olive oil (75% of the mixture)
* Truffle oil (25% of the mixture)

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F

2. Pour enough olive oil and truffle oil in baking pan/sheet to thinly cover entire surface area.

3. Move pan around to coat evenly.

4. Put pan in oven for 2-3 minutes to heat oil. Remove pan from oven.

5. Sprinkle desired seasonings in the oil.

6. Place sliced potatoes in oil (will fit about 1 large potato per baking sheet). Do not overlap!

7. Bake for 8 minutes, flip potato slices over.

8. Bake until done 5-8 min (continue to check as the outside ones will crisp sooner)

9. For round 2: Reapply some oil and seasonings. Repeat process

I am one who loves very strong flavors and a lot of spice in my food. With that in mind, This sauce was incredibly rich tasting. Very creamy, with a distinctive taste of coconut. It's not the same as taking a mouthfull of fresh coconut or drinking coconut milk, but you can discern the sweet coconut flavor. I made Chicken and shrimp Korma last night, using extremely thin sliced chicken breast (the kind of cut most oriental places put in their moo goo pai pan and other chicken dishes) The shrimp was 31-40 count. I added some fresh steamed veggies to the mix as well, and put it on a bed of Basmati rice. I heated the sauce, dumped it over top, and served it family style.

I thought the combination of the sauce with chicken, shrimp, AND veggies all worked, so its a versatile sauce. I think it might go well with just about any meat or veggie option. It did wear on my towards the end of the dish, however, due to the richness. I would have prefered a bit stronger garam masala flavor, so I compensated and added a little into the sauce. I won't be making this all the time, but every once and a while its a refreshing taste in indian cooking. I still think I'll stick to Patak's vindaloo paste. That's become a staple in my house when I'm not in the mood to make curry pastes from scratch.
I really like the ginger root beer, and have just ordered a case. But the cola was awful; had a bitter taste.

I love it.  I have to watch my sugars so I only use about 1/2 ounce as a sweetener for my shredded wheat mini biscuits.  It adds some additional flavor and a different crunch to the breakfast.  I love the subscription option.  The new batch comes just as the old is running out.

The Kashi company knows how to make cereal!!!! AAAAAAAAAAA+

I usually like something sweet to end a meal. The problem with that, of course, is the calorie overload. So then comes along this caramel and chocolate popcorn. I like the size of the pack if I've eaten something else already because it's not too big and not too small.

There's enough snack in the bag to be just right without being over the top in sweetness. Best when eaten with something else though, rather than on it's own because then, not so filling. The flavor of the drizzle and the caramels seem to be pretty balanced so one doesn't totally overtake the other and the conistency of the popcorn is just the right amount of crunch without being soggy.

I liked it and would recommend it for others who don't want a big calorie laden and heavy meal finisher or treat. My mom took a packet to work and told me several of her coworkers wanted to know where they could get their own and they're a pretty picky bunch, so it must be good!

These portion controlled treats are like an adult version of Cracker Jack - 24/1.25 oz. bags, replacing peanuts with a chocolate drizzle. I like a combination of salty and sweet, so they hit the spot for me, but other members of the household felt the salt flavor was too strong. We all agreed that the popcorn tasted fresh and the serving size was not too small. As a snack, I'd give it a 4 or 5 star rating depending on the household member rating it. As a 'healthier' option (which Snack Well's promotes) I think it is no better than other candied popcorns on the market. With 5 % total fat (vs 3%) and 13 % saturated (vs 0) I would not always choose it over our preferred candy popcorn brand, despite it tasting much fresher. That said, I would certainly get it for a change of pace, it's a very tasty treat.

Ingredients: Brown Sugar, Popcorn, Sugar, Corn Syrup, Palm and/or Palm Kernel Oil, Skim Milk, Cocoa, Whey Powder, Salt, Soybean Oil, Soy Lecithin, Vanilla Extract.
Calories 130
Calories From Fat 25

First let me say that this is only my opinion, and you know what "they" say about opinions...
A while ago I found that I had to give up coffee, which for me was tough because coffee and water are about the only two things I drink. I've never been a milk drinker, nor have I ever been big on juice. And forget tea - maybe some herb tea before bed but it's nothing I want during the day while I'm working. Enter the "coffee substitute". I found numerous brands on line. All of them claim to taste "just like the real thing" and have plenty of reviews by people just like you and me saying how wonderful the stuff is. You could probably serve these people a cup of hot yak urine and tell them it was coffee and they would tell you it was delicious. The truth is, NOTHING but coffee tastes like coffee, and anyone that tries to tell you otherwise needs a new set of taste buds. All of the coffee substitutes I've tried taste like exactly what they're made from - roasted grains, nuts and roots. Most of them contain roasted carob. Carob DOES NOT taste anything like coffee; for one, it's way too sweet. You don't want anything that contains carob. Substitutes made with dates and figs are equally as repulsive. Again - way too sweet. One of the things that gives coffee its appeal is its bitterness. A good coffee substitute has to have some bitterness. So far the only thing I've found that comes close is Orzo brand roasted organic Italian barley. If you drink it black it satisfies like coffee. It takes a few cups but it starts to "grow on you"; after drinking it for a week I've found I like it just as much as, and maybe even prefer it to, coffee. For one thing, it doesn't upset an empty stomach the way coffee does, and you can drink it after dinner without fear of it keeping you up all night.

This is the best thing ever for giving meds in pill form to a pet.  Each little "pocket" is the consistency of a soft brownie.  So they are easy to mold around even a large pill.  I have 2 dogs and both take meds with these, no picking them apart, they just swallow them whole!  Both of my dogs are small (20#) so I usually don't even use a whole pocket for their meds, I break one in half and it's plenty to cover the pill.  Great solution and really makes things so much easier when pets are sick and not even wanting to eat.  I will always keep these on hand now.

When I got these in the mail last Saturday and opened them up, put in a pill that she absolutely hates the smell of, offered it to her and she gulped it down we were thrilled to death! We have not been able to get this dog to take this particular medication using everything from hot dogs to hamburgers and several kinds of cheese, so when she ate this thing like it was candy my wife and I were both excited. Then that afternoon for her last dose for the day, same performance. We thought we had found the answer to our prayers as she has a disease that can't be cured if she doesn't take this medication until it's all gone. So this was a Godsend!

But, the very next morning, before she had anything else to eat, my wife tried to give her a pill using a Pocket and she turned her nose up at it and walked away!! She tried several times with varying amounts of the pocket cut off to make it smaller for her and easier to gulp down. Still no go. So we waited a couple of hours, without feeding her anything at all, tried again, same thing.

So I saw a bag of Pockets in Walmart and the only thing they had besides Beef was Duck so I tried that. Same thing. Wouldn't even eat one so we're back to looking for something else that might work. If your dog will eat them they are GREAT!!

My little guy loves this stuff, and I have nothing to complain about with the ingredients. It's expensive, but since my schedule makes it difficult to him feed an all-wet diet (I do a combo of wet and dry), it's worth it to me to make sure his dry food is as healthy and cat-appropriate as possible.

Just remember is that this food has a higher caloric density than most, so you don't need to feed as much as you would most dry food. The feeding guidelines on the back are too much for most indoor-only cats, so adjust accordingly.

The Harbinger is one of the hottest chiles know to man.

So it comes as no surprise that this Harbinger based sauce is quite hot - a few drops will go a long way. Yet, despite its considerable heat, it offers no other flavors beyond a vague hint of tomatoes combined with a very nasty and bitter aftertaste.

Ingredients - as copied from the label: Water, Harbinger pepper, tomato, salt, spices ... etc

Conclusion: there is a LOT of heat in this sauce but little else --- except a vague hint of tomato and a very noticeable and bitter aftertaste!

If you want even more heat (for some bizarre reason) there are other Habanero sauces where the Habanero chile is the major ingredient rather than water. There are also pepper extracts where gloves and eye protection are recommended if pure heat is what you are after. I frankly don't understand the logic that hotter is always better but tastes vary.

Conclusion: High heat, a bitter aftertaste and a vague hint of tomato. NOT recommended.

Watch out for high shipping costs from some sellers.

While on the road, I needed some food that could be prepared in a microwave. I like Indian food and I am a vegetarian so I decided to try this microwave-and-go dish. It is not the most fabulous thing in the world. The rice is highly clumpy and you don't want to eat it without mixing it with the lentils. The lentils and curry are not savory or memorable. There is some spice in the dish but not enough to make this meal escape the adjective of "bland". It was filling enough with half a piece of naan but it didn't leave me with a happy sense of satisfaction since the flavoring was boring.

This dish is vegetarian but not vegan.

Ingredients
Water, Parboiled Enriched Long Grain Rice (Rice, Niacin, Thiamine Mononitrate, Ferric Orthophosphate, Folic Acid), Lentils, Tomato Paste, Heavy Cream (Milk), Rice Starch, Canola Oil, Garlic, Spices, Sea Salt, Ginger, Sugar, Natural Flavor.

Warnings
Allergy Advice: Contains milk.

Early on, after I brought my infant son home, I experienced issues with my milk production (mainly bc I was learning how to adjust my diet to accommodate what my body was trying to do). At first, I'd ordered the Mother's Milk tea, but when it arrived, I realized it had mint in it, and I'm allergic.

Asking around, Yogi's Woman's Nursing Support was suggested by several of my breastfeeding friends (along with fenugreek capsules). And it works! I can definitely tell the days that I drink enough (4-5 cups) and when I don't (like weekends, I'm terrible of keeping up with things). I would recommend this tea to anyone seeking an herbal way to increase their breast milk production.

I like that this is a reasonably priced organic dog food that is readily available. I switched to this when the brand I had been feeding my dogs for years began to upset the tummy of my senior. However, neither of my dogs (even my "chowhound") is crazy about it. They eventually did eat it, but it took a lot of coaxing. But the tummy problems did clear up.

Two stars. One for the idea to sell someones product at double the cost, and one for all the stars out there that actually bought these from them. Hats off and enjoy the coffee. I think if you do the math now it's like $300 dollars a pound.
